## Installing Gemini CLI

```bash
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.40.3/install.sh | bash
. "$HOME/.nvm/nvm.sh"
nvm install 22
npm install -g @google/gemini-cli
gemini
```

Authentication is required on first run (copy/paste URL and key). It's recommended to run `gemini` inside a project directory.

## Accessing Shared Datasets (Experimental)

```bash
sudo apt install nfs-common
sudo mkdir /mnt/datasets
sudo mount 10.2.17.91:/mnt/datasets /mnt/datasets
```

## Connecting to the Library VPN (for library staff)

1.  Login to <https://vpn.library.ucsb.edu>, download `client.ovpn`.
2.  Upload `client.ovpn` to your workspace using the File Browser.
3.  Install VPN client:
    ```bash
    sudo apt install -y apt-transport-https curl
    sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings
    sudo sh -c 'curl -sSfL https://packages.openvpn.net/packages-repo.gpg >/etc/apt/keyrings/openvpn.asc'
    sudo sh -c 'echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/openvpn.asc] https://packages.openvpn.net/openvpn3/debian noble main" >>/etc/apt/sources.list.d/openvpn3.list'
    sudo apt update
    sudo apt install -y openvpn3
    ```
4.  Import profile: `openvpn3 config-import --config $client.ovpn`
5.  Start session: `openvpn3 session-start --config client.ovpn` (prompts for library credentials).
6.  Disconnect: `openvpn3 session-manage --disconnect --config client.ovpn`
    *   *Note:* DNS name resolution may be broken after disconnecting; `sudo systemctl restart systemd-resolved` might fix it.
